intro: Campanula rapunculoides var. ucranica, commonly known as the Ukrainian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Eastern Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
